channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘America First’ policies are threatening American exceptionalism as the economy and markets flash warning signs
item.description: "We are still betting on the resilience of consumers and the economy. However, Trump Turmoil 2.0 is significantly testing the resilience of both."

item.title: Alfred, No Longer a Cyclone, Makes Landfall in Australia
item.description: One man died in floodwaters, the authorities said, and over 330,000 customers were without power in South East Queensland.

item.title: Vladimir Putin’s ruling party gives meat grinders to mothers of soldiers killed in Ukraine as gifts
item.description: Russia is often accused of throwing its frontline soldiers into a "meat grinder" with scant regard for their lives.

item.title: At Least 12 Injured in Toronto Pub Shooting
item.description: The pub, Piper Arms, was hosting its opening night on Friday when three men walked in and “opened fire indiscriminately” before escaping by car, the p...

item.title: What We Know About the Clashes in Syria
item.description: Scores have been killed in fierce clashes between government forces and gunmen loyal to the Assad regime, in a serious challenge to the country’s new ...

item.title: Trump’s Contradictions Are His Ultimate Cover: ‘You Can’t Pin Him Down’
item.description: President Trump’s shifting positions and outright lies have presented the American public with dueling narratives at every turn.

item.title: Justice Department opens antitrust probe into egg price spike
item.description: The investigation focuses on whether companies including Cal-Maine Foods and Rose Acre Farms have colluded to boost prices or limit supply.

item.title: Social Security’s acting chief privately admits DOGE ‘will make mistakes’ as cuts delay processing of claims, report says
item.description: "DOGE people are learning and they will make mistakes, but we have to let them see what is going on at SSA."

item.title: Africa Received Billions in U.S. Aid. Here’s What It Will Lose.
item.description: The United States spent decades responding to conflicts and disease in Africa. The continent is now expected to be the hardest hit by the Trump admini...

item.title: Remains in Manitoba Landfill Are Identified as Serial Killer’s Victim
item.description: The decision to search a landfill near Winnipeg had become a political issue in the western Canadian province, largely because the victims were all In...

item.title: Atomic Detectives Who Probe Iran Sites Affected by Trump Freeze on Aid
item.description: The president’s halt of foreign aid upended two U.S. programs that help the International Atomic Energy Agency find clues about Iran’s drive to build ...

item.title: Africa Received Billions in U.S. Aid. Here’s What It Will Lose.
item.description: The United States spent decades responding to conflicts and disease in Africa. The continent is now expected to be the hardest hit by the Trump admini...

item.title: How the Tax Bill Could Impact Your Wallet
item.description: Brackets may change. The standard deduction could fall. And President Trump will probably not remove taxes on Social Security income.

item.title: Once hailed by Obama as a ‘Champion of Change,’ DOGE’s chief may be wielding extraordinary power—or not—as role remains a mystery
item.description: The uncertainty over her role — and when she was appointed to it — could have far-reaching implications in a series of ongoing lawsuits.
